jobs.title: Founding Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is an AI-powered recruiting platform. We help recruiters identify, assess, and engage the best talent.

In the last 12 months, we've scaled well into mid 7-figure revenue with 20%+ monthly growth. We have 2,500+ customers including Patreon, Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs.

We’ve raised a Series A from top VCs to scale even faster and position us as the category leader in AI recruiting. We will share more on the call.

The Role: Founding Product Designer

You’ll be our first full-time designer — with ownership over UX and UI across the entire product.

In the role, you'll tackle questions like:

  • How can we delight our users in the first 5 minutes of signing up to Juicebox?

  • How can we maximize user visibility for our agentic workflows?

You will own product features end to end — many of which will be built on LLMs. The role will span the entire Juicebox platform, including both our core platform and Juicebox agent.


There is also an opportunity to shape and own the overall Juicebox design language, including collaborating with the design agency working on our landing page, advertising strategy, and more.

About You

  • You've built something from scratch — a startup, project, or feature.

  • You've designed user-facing product features (ideally B2B or B2C SaaS).

  • You're an expert in Figma

  • You enjoy working hard and owning projects.

  • You've shown excellence: be it in your education, work experiences, projects, or anything else you can share.

  • You take asymmetric bets.

Nice to have

  • You have engineering experience or a CS degree (current tech stack includes: Next.js, React, Node.js)

  • You worked on a Product-Led-Growth (PLG) product

  • You're interested in the recruitment or talent space

Nice to have

 - You worked on a Product-Led-Growth (PLG) product

 - You're interested in the recruitment or talent space

compensationTiers.tierSummary: Base salary based on experience. $160K – $240K • Offers Equity

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

The Role: Software Engineer

As a software engineer you’ll play a key role in engineering decisions, working closely with the founders and focus on questions like:

  • How can we optimize the ranking of our profile results?

  • What new filters or data sources can we add to our search engine?

  • How can we delight our users in the first 5 minutes of signing up to Juicebox?

You will design, build, and ship product features from end to end — many of which will be built on LLMs.

Recent projects have included fine-tuning a model to extract relevant insights from profiles and building feedback loops for improving search queries.

Our current tech stack includes:

  • Next.js + React

  • Node.js

  • Firebase, OpenSearch (ElasticSearch)

  • AWS SQS, Glue, etc.

  • Open Source + OpenAI LLMs

About You

  • You've built something from scratch — a startup, project, or feature.

  • You enjoy working hard and owning projects.

  • You are hands-on, move fast, and learn best by building.

  • You've shown excellence: be it in your education, work experiences, projects, or anything else you can share.

  • You take asymmetric bets.

  • You have some experience with the core of our stack: Next.js, AWS, etc.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A https://juicebox.ai/blog/series-a led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

The Role: Software Engineer

As a software engineer you’ll play a key role in engineering decisions, working closely with the founders and focus on questions like:

 - How can we optimize the ranking of our profile results?

 - What new filters or data sources can we add to our search engine?

 - How can we delight our users in the first 5 minutes of signing up to Juicebox?

You will design, build, and ship product features from end to end — many of which will be built on LLMs.

Recent projects have included fine-tuning a model to extract relevant insights from profiles and building feedback loops for improving search queries.

Our current tech stack includes:

 - Next.js + React

 - Node.js

 - Firebase, OpenSearch (ElasticSearch)

 - AWS SQS, Glue, etc.

 - Open Source + OpenAI LLMs

About You

 - You've built something from scratch — a startup, project, or feature.

 - You enjoy working hard and owning projects.

 - You are hands-on, move fast, and learn best by building.

 - You've shown excellence: be it in your education, work experiences, projects, or anything else you can share.

 - You take asymmetric bets.

 - You have some experience with the core of our stack: Next.js, AWS, etc.

compensationTiers.tierSummary: Base salary based on experience. $160K – $220K • Offers Equity

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

Your work

  • You will onboard new customers to Juicebox and ensure they succeed

  • Build out our renewal processes

  • Create guides on best practices and update our Knowledge Base (link)

  • Resolve on-going customer issues, acting as true partner for them

  • Collaborate with the Sales team to expand customer accounts

  • Provide product feedback to our Engineering / Product team to continue to improve Juicebox

Requirements

  • Deep understanding of recruiting processes and challenges

  • Very organized, ability to manage a high number of ongoing customer threads

  • Product-mindset

  • Located in or willing to relocate to SF (in-person 5 days a week)

Nice to have

  • Experience as a recruiter or sourcer

  • Familiar with Product-Led-Growth

Compensation: $130-$180K base salary, based on experience. Commission on top for OTE of $140 - $220K. Generous benefits, including medical, dental, and vision. Lunch stipend.

jobs.title: Enterprise Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

About the Role

We're hiring an Enterprise Account Executive to join our 4-person sales team and scale Juicebox amongst our largest customers.

You’ll own mid-market and enterprise deals from our rapidly growing inbound pipeline — closing $50K–$150K+ ACV contracts.

This isn’t a traditional SaaS sales role. You'll:

  • Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and RevOps to refine our pitch and pricing

  • Have direct access to founders and engineers to unblock deals or influence roadmap

  • Get in early on a company that’s 10x'd revenue in the last 12 months and has more demand than we can handle

Why this role is different

  • All inbound, all warm: 1,000s of leads/month, 200+ demo requests/month

  • Enterprise-ready: multiple closed 6-figure deals, with many in the pipeline

  • Massive upsell potential: 2,000+ active customers, many with much larger teams

  • Strategic buyers: You’ll sell to Heads of TA, VP People, and agency owners

You're a fit if you...

  • Have closed $50K–$150K+ ACVs and love winning competitive deals

  • Thrive in a fast-moving, founder-led GTM environment

  • Are motivated by impact and upside — not layers of sales ops

  • Have 5+ years of SaaS closing experience in B2B software

  • Have a track record of quota-crushing performance (President’s Club, Top Rep, etc.)

  • Are located in or willing to relocate to San Francisco (in-office 5 days a week required)

Nice to have

  • Have sold to the Head of TA / VP People (or HR more broadly)

  • Familiar with Product-Led-Growth (using free sign-ups as your primary channel)

  • Experience working in a small GTM team (<5 people)

Compensation

  • $120-$150K base salary, based on experience.

  • Uncapped commission.

  • Generous benefits, including medical, dental, and vision.

  • Lunch stipend.

compensationTiers.tierSummary: Includes base and commission. $300K – $360K • Offers Equity

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

About the Role

We’re hiring a Founding SDR to join our 5-person sales team and fuel Juicebox’s next stage of growth.

You’ll own top-of-funnel pipeline generation - crafting strategic outbound outreach to Heads of Talent, VP People, and recruiting agency owners.

This isn’t a cookie-cutter SDR role. You’ll:

  • Partner closely with AEs, Product, and Marketing to engage prospects

  • Help refine our outbound playbook alongside our AEs

  • Get in early on a company that’s 10x’d revenue in the last 12 months and has more demand than we can handle

We’re seeing strong pull from both in-house TA teams and recruiting agencies — and many of our 2,000+ customers are ready for expansion.

If you're looking for a high-leverage role at a product-first company with real traction, this is it.

Why This Role Is Different

  • Career upside: Clear paths into AE or SDR Management roles within 12 months

  • Strategic buyers: You’ll connect with Heads of TA, VP People, and agency owners

  • Shape the playbook: Help build our outbound strategy from scratch

You’re a Fit If You…

  • Have 1+ years of sales or customer-facing experience (SaaS or startup is a plus)

  • Are a strong communicator: clear, concise, and persuasive

  • Thrive in a fast-paced, founder-led GTM environment

  • Love testing new strategies and learning from the data

  • Have experience with CRMs (HubSpot, Salesforce) and prospecting tools (Apollo, Clay)

  • Are located in or willing to relocate to San Francisco (in-office 5 days a week required)

Nice to Have

  • Experience selling to TA / HR personas

  • Experience at an early-stage startup or GTM team <5

  • Comfortable navigating Product-Led Growth environments (e.g., free sign-ups, trials)

Compensation & Benefits

  • $70K–$90K base salary, based on experience

  • $110 - $130K OTE

  • Uncapped commission, driven through qualified meetings booked quota

  • Generous benefits, including medical, dental, and vision

  • Lunch stipend

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

 - Generous benefits, including medical, dental, and vision

 - Lunch stipend

compensationTiers.tierSummary: Includes base and commission. $100K – $130K • Offers Equity

jobs.title: Founding Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

About the Role

We’re hiring a Founding Recruiter to help build out our team across both technical and non-technical roles, and play a visible role in shaping the future of recruiting itself.

This isn’t a traditional recruiting role. Juicebox is an AI sourcing platform used by thousands of recruiters, founders, and talent leaders, which means as our first in-house recruiter, you’ll become a visible leader in the recruiting community, working at the center of where modern sourcing and AI intersect.

You’ll help shape how we show up externally, through content, community, and candidate experience, to make Juicebox the top destination for top-tier talent in AI.

Why This Role Is Different

  • Shape the future of your own industry: Engage with top talent via LinkedIn, events, and content - you’ll help define how modern recruiting is done by representing the most advanced AI sourcing platform in the market.

  • Zero-to-one: You’ll create the systems, tooling, and standards that define how Juicebox hires from scratch, and partner directly with product and engineering to make our recruiter-facing AI even better.

  • High leverage: From backend engineers to GTM leads, you’ll recruit across every function. Your work will shape the trajectory of the company, and you’ll see the impact immediately.

You’re a Fit If You…

  • Have 5+ years of experience recruiting for technical and non-technical roles (either in-house or agency)

  • Have a strong personal brand in the recruiting community (e.g., active LinkedIn presence, trusted network, respected by peers)

  • Have excellent written and verbal communication - you can make a candidate feel seen and understood

  • Thrive in fast-paced, zero-to-one environments

  • Care deeply about quality and candidate experience

  • Are excited to work in-office 5 days a week with the team in SF

Nice to Have

  • Have worked with early-stage startups (Seed - Series B) or in-house at high-growth companies

  • Familiar with AI, SaaS, or B2B talent markets

  • Enjoy writing or speaking about hiring, talent, or the future of work

Compensation & Benefits

  • Medical, dental, vision

  • Lunch stipend

  • Office in downtown San Francisco (5 mins from Montgomery BART)

  • Annual offsite + team events

This isn’t a traditional recruiting role. Juicebox is an AI sourcing platform used by thousands of recruiters, founders, and talent leaders, which means as our first in-house recruiter, you’ll become a visible leader in the recruiting community, working at the center of where modern sourcing and AI intersect.

You’ll help shape how we show up externally, through content, community, and candidate experience, to make Juicebox the top destination for top-tier talent in AI.

Why This Role Is Different

 - Shape the future of your own industry: Engage with top talent via LinkedIn, events, and content - you’ll help define how modern recruiting is done by representing the most advanced AI sourcing platform in the market.

 - Zero-to-one: You’ll create the systems, tooling, and standards that define how Juicebox hires from scratch, and partner directly with product and engineering to make our recruiter-facing AI even better.

 - High leverage: From backend engineers to GTM leads, you’ll recruit across every function. Your work will shape the trajectory of the company, and you’ll see the impact immediately.

You’re a Fit If You…

 - Have 5+ years of experience recruiting for technical and non-technical roles (either in-house or agency)

 - Have a strong personal brand in the recruiting community (e.g., active LinkedIn presence, trusted network, respected by peers)

 - Have excellent written and verbal communication - you can make a candidate feel seen and understood

 - Thrive in fast-paced, zero-to-one environments

 - Care deeply about quality and candidate experience

 - Are excited to work in-office 5 days a week with the team in SF

Nice to Have

 - Have worked with early-stage startups (Seed - Series B) or in-house at high-growth companies

 - Familiar with AI, SaaS, or B2B talent markets

 - Enjoy writing or speaking about hiring, talent, or the future of work

Compensation & Benefits

 - Medical, dental, vision

 - Lunch stipend

 - Office in downtown San Francisco (5 mins from Montgomery BART)

 - Annual offsite + team events

jobs.title: Head of Community
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

About the Role

We’re hiring our first Community & Events Lead to bring the Juicebox brand to life - online and in person. You’ll build relationships with recruiters, talent leaders, and founders through high-impact events, content, and creative programming.

From sourcing dinners to tactical roundtables to conference strategy, you’ll own our community roadmap and help position Juicebox as the most trusted voice in recruiting + AI.

This is a high-visibility, high-creativity role that sits at the intersection of marketing, customer success, and brand.

Why This Role Is Different

🎤 You’ll be the face of the brand – building relationships with some of the best talent teams and amplifying their stories.
📣 High trust, high ownership – you’ll run point on strategy and execution with direct support from founders.
🎯 Clear impact – your work will drive revenue, loyalty, and long-term brand affinity.
🎨 Creative runway – you'll shape what community means in a new category.

What You’ll Do

  • Plan and execute in-person events (dinners, panels, field marketing, offsites)

  • Launch and grow our community programs (e.g. Slack, referral groups, customer spotlights)

  • Partner with Sales and Customer Success to identify customer champions and storytelling opportunities

  • Coordinate logistics, vendors, comms, and promotion for each event

  • Create repeatable playbooks for event and community engagement

  • Track success metrics across engagement, retention, and brand reach

You’re a Fit If You...

  • Have 3+ years experience in community, events, field marketing, or brand, with previous SaaS experience

  • Are an exceptional communicator – warm, articulate, and detail-obsessed

  • Have experience organizing high-quality B2B conferences and events (bonus if with talent or GTM audiences

  • Know how to build systems from scratch and aren’t afraid to get scrappy

  • Are based in SF or willing to relocate (role is in-office 5 days/week)

Nice to Have

  • Familiar with recruiting, HR tech, or B2B SaaS

  • Experience building executive-level or industry communities

  • A strong creative eye and/or content instincts

  • Prior experience working directly with founders or early-stage teams

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager, Agents
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

About the Role

We're hiring a Customer Success Manager focused on our AI Agents — a flagship product that helps recruiting teams run searches, write outreach, and uncover hidden candidates with just a prompt.

You’ll own the full customer lifecycle for Agent adoption: onboarding, education, expansion, and retention. You’ll partner closely with Sales to drive upsells, work cross-functionally with Product to shape roadmap feedback, and serve as the go-to resource for helping customers get real outcomes with AI-powered sourcing.

This is a strategic, customer-facing role with direct revenue impact, and a key part of how we scale the future of recruiting.

What You’ll Do

  • Own adoption, expansion, and retention of Juicebox’s Agent product

  • Deliver live customer onboarding, training, and usage reviews

  • Identify upsell opportunities and partner with Sales to close them

  • Help customers integrate Agents into their sourcing workflows

  • Proactively surface product feedback, usage gaps, and new feature needs

  • Act as the internal voice of the customer across Product and Engineering

  • Track and improve Agent activation, engagement, and expansion metrics

You’re a Fit If You...

  • Have 2–5+ years experience in Customer Success, Account Management, or Sales roles

  • Are a strong communicator — confident with both execs and sourcers

  • Are comfortable in live calls, product walkthroughs, and upsell conversations

  • Are analytical — you care about usage metrics, feedback loops, and measurable outcomes

  • Have worked in fast-paced environments where you wore multiple hats

  • Are based in SF or open to relocating (in-office 5 days/week)

Nice to Have

  • Experience with AI tools, recruiting tech, or B2B SaaS

  • Background in agency or in-house recruiting

  • Familiarity with tools like HubSpot, PostHog, Notion, or Clay

  • Exposure to Product or Sales orgs, especially in early-stage companies

Compensation: $130-$180K base salary, based on experience. Commission on top for OTE of $140 - $220K. Generous benefits, including medical, dental, and vision. Lunch stipend.

jobs.title: Product Specialist (Support)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

About the Role

We're hiring a Product Specialist to sit at the heart of customer support and product quality. You’ll respond to live support requests, investigate bugs in real time, and work closely with engineering and product to ensure issues are resolved quickly and clearly.

You’ll play a key role in keeping our customers unblocked, and helping our team stay fast, focused, and close to user pain.

What You’ll Do

  • Respond to incoming support tickets and product questions (Intercom, Slack, email)

  • Investigate live issues, replicate bugs, and gather technical details

  • Create well-scoped bug reports with context, repro steps, and priority guidance

  • Partner with engineering and product to coordinate resolution and track progress

  • Follow up with users once fixes or workarounds are in place

  • Maintain clean documentation, internal tools, and support workflows (Linear, Notion, etc.)

  • Spot recurring themes in feedback and flag insights to product leadership

You’re a Fit If You...

  • Have 1–3+ years of experience in support engineering, product ops, or customer support at a SaaS company

  • Are a clear and calm communicator — especially when customers are blocked

  • Are curious and scrappy — you dig into bugs, run tests, and clarify edge cases

  • Can balance fast response times with thoughtful root cause analysis

  • Are organized, proactive, and comfortable coordinating across functions

  • Are based in SF or open to relocating (in-office 5 days/week)

Nice to Have

  • Prior experience in AI, SaaS, or recruiting tech

  • Technical / product manager background

  • Experience with tools like Linear, Notion, Intercom, HubSpot, or PostHog

  • Ability to write internal documentation, create bug tickets, or support triage automation

jobs.title: Engineering Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Juicebox

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

About the role

We're looking to add a strong senior IC who can take over major parts of the codebase and help maintain technical velocity as we scale. This person will work closely with the founders, act as a high-trust reviewer, and raise the bar for engineering quality and speed. You’ll shape architectural decisions and mentor teammates — without needing to manage people. Perfect for someone who wants autonomy, impact, and to be part of a tight, flat org shipping fast.

What we’re looking for (technical)

  • You have hands-on experience building features / leading projects from scratch

  • You have a deep understanding of systems and infrastructure

  • You have experience with JS frameworks and full-stack web apps

  • You’ve been in fast-paced startup environments

What we’re looking for (non technical)

  • You’re good at (1) learning things quickly and (2) getting things done.

  • You've shown excellence: be it in your education, work experiences, projects, or anything else you can share.

  • You’re good at communication and enjoy working in person.

Nice to haves

  • You were / want to be a founder.

  • You have experience with large-scale data pipelines or search clusters.

Compensation & Benefits

  • Medical, dental, vision

  • Lunch stipend

  • Office in downtown San Francisco

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

Juicebox is on a mission to help teams win the talent war.

In the age of AI, human ingenuity is the ultimate scarce resource. Recruiting is a zero-sum game where you either compete or lose.

Teams at Ramp, Perplexity, and leading AI labs use Juicebox to power their hiring, alongside 3,000+ customers from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies.

We’ve crossed $10M in ARR with 20%+ monthly growth, powering thousands of searches every day and making Juicebox one of the fastest-growing AI SaaS companies in the world.

Juicebox has raised $36M in funding, including a $30M Series A led by Sequoia Capital. Additional investors in Juicebox include Coatue, NFDG, Lux Capital, Y Combinator, and BOND Capital.

GTM at Juicebox

  • All pipeline is inbound through either our free trial or our demo form; 200+ inbound demos each month.

  • Core customer groups include in-house TA teams and recruiting agencies.

  • Deal cycles are 2-3 weeks (depending on whether the prospect does a trial).

  • There's a large opportunity to upsell our existing 2,000+ customers, many of which have larger recruiting teams.

  • We consistently win against legacy recruiting tech products.

Requirements

  • Experience closing ACVs of $10K - $50K

  • 2+ years experience in SaaS sales

  • Track record of exceeding quota (Presidents Club, Top 10%, MVP, etc.)

  • Located in or willing to relocate to SF

Nice to have

  • Have sold to the Head of TA / VP People (or HR more broadly)

  • Familiar with Product-Led-Growth (using free sign-ups as your primary channel)

  • Experience working in a small GTM team (<5 people)

Compensation: $100-$120K base salary, based on experience. Uncapped commission. Generous benefits, including medical, dental, and vision. Lunch stipend.
